text: John Ogle Anderson (1912–1969Manitoba History Society) was an Anglican bishop in the mid 20th century. Anderson was born in Manitoba and educated at St. John's College, Winnipeg."Who was Who" 1897-1990 London, A & C Black, 1991 Ordained in 1937, after curacies at St Anne's, WandsworthChurch website and All Saints’ Winnipeg he was a chaplain during World War II with the Canadian Grenadier Guards and then rector of St Aidan's Winnipeg from 1946 to 1949. He was Dean of Rupert's Land (Winnipeg) (1949-1954) and then of Ottawa (1954-1962) before his ordination to the episcopate as Bishop of Red River, a suffragan bishop of Rupert's Land. In 1967 he was translated to British Columbia but died the following year. == References == Category:1912 births Category:1969 deaths Category:People from Winnipeg Category:University of Manitoba alumni Category:Anglican deans Category:Anglican bishops of British Columbia Category:20th-century Anglican bishops Category:Canadian military chaplains Category:World War II chaplains Category:Deans of Ottawa
